detaileddescription.para: Creates a unit circle i.e. a circle with a radius of 1.
Creates a circle with a radius of radius and its centre (x,y) set to 0.
Creates a unit circle with a radius of 1 and its centre point set to (x,y).

memberdef.argsstring: (const float radius, const float x, const float y)
memberdef.name: Circle

detaileddescription.para: Creates a circle with a radius of radius and its centre point set to (x,y).
Creates a circle with a radius of radius and its centre point set to position.
Creates a copy of the circle copy.
Destroys this circle

memberdef.argsstring: (const float x, const float y) const
memberdef.name: angle

detaileddescription.para: Returns the angle of the coordinate (x,y). The angle will be expressed either in degrees or radians depending on which mode is set in setAngleMode(). By default DEGREES mode is set.

simplesect.para: Returns the angle of the coordinate (x,y).

detaileddescription.para: This is an overloaded function. Returns the angle of the Pointf position. The angle will be expressed either in degrees or radians depending on which mode is set in setAngleMode(). By default DEGREES mode is set.

simplesect.para: Returns the angle of the Pointf position.
Returns Circle::DEGREES or Circle::RADIANS depending on which mode is set. By default a circle is set to DEGREES mode.

detaileddescription.para:
An arc is the section of the circumference that sits between two points.
Returns the length of the minor arc between the points p1 and p2.

simplesect.para: Returns the area of the circle.
Returns the y-coordinate of the bottom edge of the circle.

detaileddescription.para: A central angle is formed by two radii extending from the centre point of the circle to the circumference. Note that the smallest angle will be returned and is always positive i.e. if moving in one direction from point to point around the circle gives an angle of 270ยบ and moving in the opposite direction gives an angle of 90ยบ then 90ยบ is returned. The angle will be expressed either in degrees or radians depending on which mode is set in setAngleMode(). By default DEGREES mode is set.

simplesect.para: Returns the central angle formed by two points on the circumference.
Returns a Pointf representing the centre point of the circle.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float x, const float y) const
memberdef.name: contains

simplesect.para: Returns true if the circle contains (or is on the circumference) the point (x,y), false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para:
This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the circle contains (or is on the circumference) the point position, false otherwise.

This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the circle contains (or is on the circumference) the circle represented by otherCircle, false otherwise.

simplesect.para: Returns the circumference of the circle.
Returns the diameter of the circle.

detaileddescription.para: Extracts the radius and centre x and y coordinates and assigns them to radius, x and y.

simplesect.para: Returns true if this circle intersects with otherCircle, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para:
A valid circle is one which has a radius larger than 0.
Returns true if the circle is valid, false otherwise.

simplesect.para: Returns the x-coordinate of the left edge of the circle.

detaileddescription.para: Moves the circle on the y-axis so that its bottom-most point sits at y.
Moves the centre point of the circle to (x,y).
This is an overloaded function. Moves the centre point of the circle to position.
Moves the circle on the x-axis so that its left-most point sits at x;
Moves the circle on the x-axis so that its right-most point sits at x;
Moves the circle so that its top-most point sits at y.

If a circle has a negative value for a radius it can be normalised so that its radius is positive again by flipping the negative value to a positive one. For e.g. a radius of -5 will become 5 after normalisation.
Returns a normalised copy of this circle.

simplesect.para: Returns the (x,y) coordinate on the circumference at an angle of angle. The angle argument can either be in degrees or radians depending on which mode is set in setAngleMode().

detaileddescription.para: This calculates divisions amount of evenly spaced points around the circumference in a clockwise direction. For example, passing in 12 as the argument means that the vector will contain 12 evenly spaced points exactly like the notches on a clock face.

simplesect.para: A vector containing divisions amount of points.
Returns the radius of the circle.
Returns the x-coordinate of the right edge of the circle.

detaileddescription.para: A sector visually is like a slice of pizza. Its base is the centre point of the circle with two radii extending from the centre to the circumference. The major sector area can be found by subtracting the area of the minor sector from the total area of the circle.

simplesect.para: Returns the area of the minor sector formed by the centre point of the circle and points p1 and p2 located on the circumference.

detaileddescription.para: A segment is formed by drawing a line (known as a chord) from one point on the circumference to another point (effectively splitting the circle in two). The area of the major segment can be found by subtracting the minor segment area from the total area of the circle.

simplesect.para: Returns the area of the minor segment formed by the points p1 and p2.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the angle mode of the circle to work with degrees or radians. By default the circle is set to DEGREES mode. The mode can be changed by passing in Circle::DEGREES or Circle::RADIANS.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float radius, const float x, const float y)
memberdef.name: setCircle

detaileddescription.para: Sets the radius to radius and positions the centre of the circle at (x,y).
This is an overloaded function. Sets the radius to radius and positions the centre of the circle at position.
Sets the diameter of the circle to diameter.
Sets the radius of the circle to radius.
Sets the centre of the circle to x in the x-axis.
Sets the centre of the circle to y in the y-axis.

simplesect.para: Returns the y-coordinate of the top edge of the circle.

detaileddescription.para: Translates the circle relative to its current position by dx on the x-axis and dy on the y-axis.
This is an overloaded function. Translates the circle relative to its current position by the amount of offset.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float dx, const float dy) const
memberdef.name: translated

simplesect.para: Returns a copy of this circle which has been translated relative to its current position by dx and dy.

detaileddescription.para:
This is an overloaded function.
Returns a copy of this circle which has been translated relative to its current position by offset.

A unit circle is one which has a radius of 1.
Returns a copy of this circle which has been converted to a unit circle. This does not affect the circle's position as it retains its (x,y) coordinates.

simplesect.para: Returns a new bounding circle that contains this circle and otherCircle.
Returns the centre of the circle in the x-axis.
Returns the centre of the circle in the y-axis.

detaileddescription.para: Assigns other to this circle.

simplesect.para: Returns true if both circles have the same radius and (x,y) centre point, false otherwise.
Returns true if both circles are not equal, false otherwsie.
Returns true if c1 has a smaller radius than c2, false otherwise.
Returns true if c1 has a greater radius than c2, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Allows an instance of Circle to be written to the ostream and returns a reference to the ostream.
This class represents the data model of a circle. It does not have a visual side.
